009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015
016import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Vector version of the Nagao-Matsuyama filter. This class implements a 5x5 Nagao-Matsuyama filter, as described in
021 * [1]. See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for additional details.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] M. Nagao and T. Matsuyama. Edge preserving smoothing. Computer Graphics and Image Processing 9(4), 394â€“407
025 * (1979).
026 * <br>
027 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
028 * (2022).
029 * </p>
030 */
031public class NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements NagaoMatsuyamaF {
032
033        // uses the same subregions as defined in {@link NagaoMatsuyamaFilterScalar}
034        
035        private final float varThreshold;
036        private float minVariance;
037        private final float[] rgb = new float[3];
038        private final float[] minMean = new float[3];
039        
040        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector() {
041                this(new Parameters());
042        }
043        
044        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector(Parameters params) {
045                this.varThreshold = (float) params.varThreshold;
046        }
047        
048        // ------------------------------------------------------
049        
050        @Override
051        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
052                minVariance = Float.MAX_VALUE;
053                evalSubregionColor(pack, Constants.R0, u, v);
054                minVariance = minVariance - 3 * varThreshold;
055                for (int[][] Rk : Constants.SubRegions) {
056                        evalSubregionColor(pack, Rk, u, v);
057                }
058                Matrix.copyD(minMean, rgb);
059                return rgb;
060        }
061        
062        void evalSubregionColor(PixelPack ia, int[][] R, int u, int v) {
063                final float[] S1 = new float[3];        // sum of pixel values
064                final float[] S2 = new float[3];        // sum of squared pixel values
065                int n = 0;
066                for (int[] p : R) {
067                        final float[] cp = ia.getPix(u + p[0], v + p[1]);
068                        
069                        S1[0] = S1[0] + cp[0];
070                        S1[1] = S1[1] + cp[1];
071                        S1[2] = S1[2] + cp[2];
072                        
073                        S2[0] = S2[0] + sqr(cp[0]);
074                        S2[1] = S2[1] + sqr(cp[1]);
075                        S2[2] = S2[2] + sqr(cp[2]);
076                        
077                        n = n + 1;              // pixel count in subregion
078                }
079                // calculate variance for this subregion:
080                float var0 = (S2[0] - sqr(S1[0]) / n) / n;      // variance red
081                float var1 = (S2[1] - sqr(S1[1]) / n) / n;      // variance green
082                float var2 = (S2[2] - sqr(S1[2]) / n) / n;      // variance blue
083                // total variance:
084                float totalVar = var0 + var1 + var2;    
085                if (totalVar < minVariance) {
086                        minVariance = totalVar;
087                        minMean[0] = S1[0] / n;
088                        minMean[1] = S1[1] / n;
089                        minMean[2] = S1[2] / n;
090                }
091        }
092
093}
